column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=Polycrystalline sample of Co4Nb2O9 was synthesized by standard solid state reaction route.
#Text=Stoichiometric amount of pure Co3O4 (Alfa Aesar, 98.0%), and Nb2O5 (Alfa Aesar, 98.0%), were used.
#Text=The mixture was well ground for several hours in agate mortar-pestle.
#Text=After grinding, the mixture was sintered at 900°C for10 hrs in air.
#Text=After the first sintering, the mixture was again well ground for few hours and then pressed in form of pellets (Diameter = 5 mm, thickness= 0.5 mm).
#Text=These pellets were heated again in air at 1100°C for another 6 hrs.
#Text=Both heating and cooling rates were kept at a rate of 5°C/min.
#Text=Phase purity was confirmed at room temperature powder X-ray diffraction (Rigaku Ultima III X-ray diffractometer with Cu-Kα radiation).
#Text=Lattice parameters were obtained from Rietveld refinement of the X-ray data using RIETAN 2000 software.
#Text=The DC magnetization measurements were done in VSM mode of a Cryogenic Physical Property Measurement System (PPMS).
#Text=The dielectric measurements were done using an Agilent E4980A LCR meter.
#Text=For pyroelectric and dielectric measurements, electrodes were prepared on the sample by painting silver paste on the planar surfaces.
#Text=The pyroelectric measurement was performed using a Kiethley 6514 electrometer and polarization was derived from the pyroelectric current by integrating over time.
#Text=The sample was poled each time from well above ordering temperature under various combinations of electric and magnetic field.
#Text=The poling field was removed at lowest temperature and terminals were sorted for 15 minutes to avoid any role of electrostatic stray charges.
#Text=The warming ramp rate was fixed at 5 K/min.
#Text=For dielectric measurements, silver paste was used to make contacts onto disc-shaped ceramic samples of 5 mm diameter and 0.5 mm thickness.
